post.description: Public self-registration for customers. Creates a User account with 'Passenger' role and a corresponding Passenger record. Account requires email verification before login. This is NOT for walk-in passengers - those are created by booking clerks at the counter.

message.example: Account created successfully! Please check your email to verify your account.

items.example: The email has already been taken.
The phone has already been taken.

post.description: Self-registration for Booking Clerks, Conductors, Cashiers, Inspectors, Receptionists, and Drivers. Account is created with 'pending' status and requires admin approval before the user can login. Not available for Admin or Super Admin roles.

id_number.description: ID number (optional, required if id_type is provided)

message.example: Staff account created. Please verify your email and wait for admin approval.

get.summary: Verify email address via verification link
get.description: Verifies user's email address using the verification link sent to their email. The hash must match sha1 of the user's email address.

400.description: Invalid verification link or already verified

post.description: Resends the email verification link to the user's email address. Only works if email is not already verified.

email.description: Email address to resend verification to

message.example: No user found with this email address.

post.description: Generates a hash-based verification link for testing email verification without sending actual emails. Use this link with the verify-email endpoint.
Authenticates user with email and password. Returns user details and Sanctum token. Supports 2FA if enabled. Email must be verified before login (unless requires_email_verification is false).

code.description: 2FA code (required only if 2FA is enabled for this user)

items.example: The provided email does not exist in our records.

403.description: Email not verified, account inactive, or 2FA required

message.example: Please verify your email before logging in.

post.description: Invalidates the current user's authentication token. User must be authenticated to logout.

get.description: Returns the complete profile of the currently authenticated user including role, company, and creator information.

post.description: Update profile information. Supports partial updates - only send fields you want to change.
